item.title: Fallout 76 Fan Has Creepy Encounter With Another Player
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fallout 76 Season 17 recently released Skyline Valley, with new weapons, armor, characters, and critters to explore.
  • A player encountered what appeared to be an alien, but it was just a bug that happens when wearing power armor.
  • Players can anticipate transforming into ghouls in Fallout 76 in 2025, with additional updates planned for the next several years.

A Fallout 76 player ran into an otherworldly entity, standing creepily as it gazed in their direction, and decided to share the off-putting image online. Post-apocalyptic Appalachia has attracted an influx of new and returning players, as Bethesda recently kicked off the game's Season 17 and released the first ever map expansion for Fallout 76, an area in the south called Skyline Valley.

Fallout 76 ’s Skyland Valley update introduced a swathe of new features for players to check out, including weapons and armor, as well as new characters and critters to interact with. Those interested in the game’s lore also have several additional quests to complete, notes to collect, and a couple of public events to participate in. Of course, along with all that new content inevitably come a few bugs, though this particular one seems to be an oldie.

Reddit user r0ttingp0tat0 encountered what appeared to be some kind of alien figure in Fallout 76, with elongated limbs and oversized hands that resemble claws. This freaky creature, it turns out, was actually another player. The Redditor, however, exclaimed that their boyfriend, who was presumably playing alongside r0ttingp0tat0 in the game, couldn’t see the disconcerting phenomenon.

The Creepy Figure Was Just Another Fallout 76 Player

Gamers expecting that r0ttingp0tat0 had perhaps encountered a new type of alien might be disappointed to learn that this hair-raising apparition was in fact just a known bug in Fallout 76. As pointed out by another Reddit user, this is a glitch that has carried over from Fallout 4, where it was reportedly fixed. Another fan explained that it happens when a player puts on power armor in Fallout 76 . The game apparently stretches the limbs to fit the armor, and this unsettling glitch appears when the power armor becomes invisible, when logging in or out, for example. To this comment, someone humorously replied, “So… there’s a chance that this elongated man in his underwear has the strength of someone in a suit of power armor. Terrifying.”

Creepy manifestations aside, fans hoping to look similar to r0ttingp0tat0's sighting will have to settle for becoming a mutated human instead. Bethesda has revealed that it is adding the ability for players to transform into ghouls in Fallout 76 . The feature is expected to arrive sometime in 2025 and will involve a quest that can be started after reaching level 50. Additionally, the Maryland-based developer plans to release updates for the game for the “next several years,” giving fans of the action RPG plenty to look forward to.

item.title: Monster Hunter Stories: All Egg Patterns (& How to Find Them)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Are Eggs In Monster Hunter Stories?
  • All Eggs & Their Locations In Monster Hunter Stories

Monster Hunter Stories is the first in the Monster Hunter series that follows a Monster Rider, someone who works together and lives in harmony with monsters rather than hunting them. The game has been remastered for modern consoles, allowing more players to see this side of the game franchise.

While playing the game, players will need to help their Monsties grow and forge relationships with them. One way that players can do this is by finding eggs around the game and hatching them into Monsties. Here's a complete guide to eggs in the game.

What Are Eggs In Monster Hunter Stories?

Monster Eggs come from Monster Dens around the game. These are randomly spawned and generated locations in the game. However, there are a few fixed Monster Dens around the game that will guarantee a specific Monstie. In order to find these, players will need to progress the story and use a Paintball on a Monster in battle so they can follow it. Other than that, these are randomly spawned around the game. There are three types of Monster Dens:

  • Normal - The eggs from here are usually average.
  • Gold - The eggs from here are usually rare.
  • Red - The eggs from here are usually the rarest.

Additionally, these items will have various smells and weights. Eggs that don't have a scent will have the worst genes, while those that are smelly will have better genes. Finally, the eggs that are nice-smelling will have the best genes. In the same vein, eggs that are lighter won't have as many gene slots, and those that are heavy will have the most gene slots.

Once an egg is found, Narvirou will make a comment about the egg. Depending on his comment, players will be able to tell the rarity of the egg that they have found. If he thinks it is normal , it is an average egg. If he mentions that he feels pretty good about it, then this is the rarest kind. He can also make a comment about the egg feeling dangerous ; if this is the case, there is a tough Monster guarding it.

All Eggs & Their Locations In Monster Hunter Stories

There are a ton of different Monster Eggs players can find in the game. Here's a breakdown of those eggs, their patterns, what type of monster they are, and where they can be found.

item.title: How Gears of War: E-Day Would Benefit From Focusing on Jacinto
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gears of War: E-Day takes players back to the beginning of the Locust War in a prequel setting.
  • Jacinto, a key COG stronghold, could play an important role as players face the Locust attacks in the game.
  • The game focuses on a young Marcus and Dom as humanity battles the Locust Horde.

The Coalition’s upcoming mainline entry in the Gears of War series, Gears of War: E-Day , will bring players back to the beginning of the Locust War. Throughout E-Day ’s announcement trailer, teases are woven in to set up themes and events players will encounter in the game, such as Gears getting acclimated to fighting the Locust drones.

By the end of the trailer, Marcus is almost swallowed up by an Emergence Hole before being saved by Dom as they overlook a city being consumed by E-Holes and attacked by Locust forces. While this city has not been identified, it may be the city of Jacinto, a location familiar to Gears of War 2 fans that could play a pivotal role in Gears of War: E-Day .

Gears of War: E-Day, COG Cities, and Jacinto

When the Locust first attacked the surface, all human organizations were ill-prepared for a military attack coming from underground. Queen Myrrah and Locust High General Raam specifically targeted the Coalition of Ordered Governments (COG) and remnant Union of Independent Republics (UIR) nations and cities to begin their culling of the human race. It’s estimated that 25% of all humans on Sera were killed on E-Day . However, some cities were protected by natural elements, such as island-based cities or cities built on top of thick bedrock.

Jacinto was one such city spared by its natural defense of bedrock in the Jacinto Plateau. It was located in the nation of Tyrus and served as a COG stronghold for most of the Locust War. Despite these natural defenses, many cities in Tyrus and the plateau were attacked on E-Day, including the former COG capital city of Ephyra. A portion of Ephyra’s Locust invasion can be seen in the prologue of Gears of War 4 , with the player defending the House of Sovereigns alongside Corporal Minh Young Kim.

The Fall of Jacinto

14 years after E-Day , Jacinto became the new COG capital following the fall of Ephyra. In Gears of War 2 , the Locust planned to use a giant riftworm to sink the city into the nearby sea to destroy both the COG and Imulsion-infected Lambent in the Locust Hollow. Marcus and Delta Squad managed to evacuate most of Jacinto’s forces and sink the city before the Locust could evacuate the Hollow. This event crippled both the COG and the Locust military.

Jacinto’s Potential Roles in Gears of War: E-Day

While Jacinto was largely unscathed from the Locust invasion on E-Day , The Coalition could still have a few E-Holes appear on the edge of Jacinto in Gears of War: E-Day . With the game’s emphasis on horror and the surprise attack of the Locust, even a few Locust squads could cause chaos in the city in E-Day . This small Locust force may serve as a simple scouting party for Raam and could illustrate how destructive even a small Locust force can be to ill-prepared Gears. If portions of Locust lore or perspectives are shown in E-Day , having an attack on Jacinto could set up Queen Myrrah’s plan to tame the giant riftworm and eventually destroy Jacinto and other cities.

While Jacinto City first appears in 2008’s Gears of War 2 , Dom actually breaks Marcus out of Jacinto Maximum Security Prison at the beginning of 2006’s Gears of War 1 .

If the city shown in the trailer isn’t Jacinto, the city could still play a pivotal role in the game. Marcus and Dom could begin the game in Jacinto and watch news reports of the Locust invasions across Sera in the city. Perhaps the pair could encounter some civilians claiming that the Locust attacks are fake or that they’re a scheme made up by UIR remnants before they’re deployed to another city to address the Locust invasions. This could provide players with some beneficial world-building for the state of the COG after the Pendulum Wars. It could further contrast the peaceful lifestyle of civilians in Jacinto to the horrors inflicted on other cities in Tyrus and the Jacinto Plateau in Gears of War: E-Day .

item.title: Overwatch 2 - Season 11 Super Mega Ultrawatch Official Trailer
item.description: Season 11 for Overwatch 2 introduces 2 new mythic skins, the return of Pink Mercy, a new map, and many more gameplay changes.

item.title: Wolverine Gameplay Leak Reveals How Traversal Will Work
item.description:
Highlights

  • A new leak shows how traversal will work in Marvel's Wolverine, with many comparing Logan's movements to those found in Insomniac's Spider-Man games.
  • Spec Ops: The Line writer Walt D. Williams is adding a darker tone to Marvel's Wolverine, which still doesn't have a concrete release date.
  • Previous leaks have hinted that players will visit the X-Mansion and Logan will be able to heal himself using his mutant abilities.

A new leak is giving fans a glimpse at how traversal will work in Marvel’s Wolverine , and it looks very similar to developer Insomniac’s previous comic book games. Insomniac announced that it was building upon its already successful Marvel gaming universe with a Wolverine game way back in 2021, with Spec Ops: The Line writer Walt D. Williams lending his talents to a story that is reportedly much darker and grittier than the more lighthearted Marvel’s Spider-Man games.

While there haven’t been too many official Marvel’s Wolverine announcements since its PlayStation Showcase 2021 reveal, many details about the game have been leaked since the now-infamous Insomniac data breach last winter. In addition to the game’s plot, characters, and voice cast, the alpha footage and source code unearthed in these leaks have hinted that Marvel’s Wolverine will feature healing that mirrors one of Logan’s signature mutant abilities, as well as a trip to the iconic X-Mansion.

Yet another potential snippet of Marvel’s Wolverine gameplay was recently shared by 404LEAK_ on Twitter, with a post on r/GamingLeaksAndRumours discussing the footage. The video consists of a brief clip of Wolverine in a version of his famous yellow-and-blue X-Men costume navigating a city street at night, using his Adamantium claws to scale up buildings and jump across rooftops. Many have pointed out the similarities between this supposed traversal gameplay and the mechanics found in Insomniac’s Spider-Man games, while others are comparing it to Xbox’s Crackdown series.

Marvel’s Wolverine Could Have Spider-Man-Style Traversal

This wasn’t the only new Marvel’s Wolverine footage leaked recently, as a YouTube user named Chris J also posted a scene taken from an unofficial Wolverine PC build that shows more of the game’s traversal system in action as Logan travels through a town in search of a place called “Princess Bar.” Once he finds the place, he has to defend himself from a squad of ninjas by slashing at them with his claws and throwing items like bar stools and beer bottles. Just like Peter in Spider-Man 2 , Logan seemingly can activate some kind of enhanced stage by pressing the joysticks after receiving enough damage.

It should be noted that this leaked Marvel’s Wolverine footage was taken from an unfinished build of the game, and could very likely have been changed or upgraded since it was first unearthed in the Insomniac ransomware attack. As more of these leaks and potential spoilers continue to surface online, fans are being advised to take the information presented in them with a grain of salt until more concrete details are unveiled.
